Hi,

this might be a hard to decide question like spaces vs. tabs: I might =
have an
addressbook web application that has mainly two sites

/myapp/conta=
cts (or /myapp/contacts/ ?)
/myapp/contacts/{id}

Should the /myapp/contact=
s URI have a trailing slash or not?

From an implementation perspective I l=
ike the trailing slash so that I can
just use the contact id as a relative =
URI from the collection resource. But on
the other site a collection might =
also be a resource?

Thank you for any recommendation!

Best regards, Thoma=
s Koch
